meta.title: Session 29: Academic Calendar Design
meta.description: Learn to design personalized Academic Calendars with photos using Excel and master digital scheduling with Google Calendar.

studyTopics.hint: A schedule used by schools to plan the year.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an 'Academic Calendar'?
options: To schedule school events, exams, holidays, and terms
questions.explanation: An academic calendar serves as the central schedule for an educational institution's yearly activities.

questions.question: Which tab in Excel allows you to insert a photo into your calendar?
questions.explanation: The Insert tab contains the 'Pictures' command needed to add photos.

questions.question: In Google Calendar, what does a 'Recurring Event' do?
options: Automatically repeats the event (e.g., every Monday) without needing to create it again
questions.explanation: Recurring events save time by automatically scheduling repeating activities like weekly classes.

questions.question: To quickly create a calendar in Excel without starting from scratch, you should search for a:
questions.explanation: Excel offers pre-designed 'Calendar Templates' (File > New) that already have dates and formatting set up.

questions.question: How can teachers use calendars effectively?
options: To track lesson plans, assessment dates, and student progress milestones
questions.explanation: Calendars are essential planning tools for teachers to organize the curriculum and deadlines.

questions.question: If you want your photo to fit exactly inside a calendar box (cell) in Excel, you might need to:
options: Resize the image and adjust the Row Height/Column Width
questions.explanation: Images float over cells by default; you must manually resize them and adjust the grid to make them look like they are 'inside' the box.

questions.question: Which function allows you to share your digital Google Calendar with students or parents?
questions.explanation: Google Calendar allows you to share access via email or a public link so others can view events.

questions.question: [Digital Skill] What is a benefit of using a Cloud-based calendar (like Google Calendar) over a paper one?
options: It syncs across all devices (phone/laptop) and can send automatic reminders
questions.explanation: Cloud sync ensures your schedule is always up-to-date on any device you use.

questions.question: To format the days of the week (Mon, Tue, Wed) to look bold and centered, you would use:
questions.explanation: Basic formatting tools on the Home tab allow you to style the text headers.

questions.question: What is the function of the '=TODAY()' formula in Excel?
questions.explanation: TODAY() returns the current system date.

questions.question: Which feature helps you assign a specific color to different types of events (e.g., Red for Exams, Blue for Holidays)?
questions.explanation: Color coding helps visually categorize different types of events for quick recognition.

questions.question: Can you print a Google Calendar?
options: Yes, using the Settings > Print option
Only if you take a screenshot
questions.explanation: Google Calendar has a built-in print feature to generate a physical copy of your schedule.

questions.question: When creating a calendar in Excel, merging cells across the top row is usually done to:
options: Create space for the Month Name and Year title
questions.explanation: Merging the top cells creates a centered header area for the main title (e.g., 'October 2025').

questions.question: Which AI capability helps modern calendar apps find the best meeting time for a group?
questions.explanation: AI scheduling tools analyze everyone's availability to suggest optimal meeting slots automatically.

questions.question: To add a border around every day box in your Excel calendar, use:
questions.explanation: The 'All Borders' option applies gridlines around every selected cell, defining the calendar days.
